import React, { Component } from 'react'; import '../App.css'; import { Card, CardDeck } from 'react-bootstrap'; import{ BrowserRouter, Link } from 'react-router-dom'; const CairnMaintenance = () =>{ return (
Cairn Maintenance

Positive Reinforcement Training

Positive Reinforcement Training or PRT I feel is the best and only way to train any breed, big or small. The overall concept behind it is only rewarding positive behavior and discouraging any negative or bad behavior. While training using the PRT method no physical abuse like slapping or hitting should ever be done or needed. PRT is more effective than any other training method I have found and will never require slapping, hitting or shocking. Again this goes for cairns all the way up to mastiffs, you never need to hit a dog to teach it. When training, avoid using their main source of food as a reward or this can lead to food bowl aggression.

Vaccines & Medications

Do what your veterinarian recommends as certain vaccines are more crucial to have in different parts of the country than others. Certain parts of the country have different types of potential dangers. For example, some parts of the country have wood ticks others do not, some have more species of parasitic worms do to climate and winter temperature allowing, some parasites to live in thrive in some areas. Some gruesome facts about parasites like the heartworm are commonly transmitted from being on a mosquitoes mouth before the mosquitoes bits your puppy. I do not regularly treat mine for fleas or ticks and never had problems. When I will be traveling with them, they will be using shared pet relief areas, so I know I have to adminaster a prevention Medication for fleas and ticks as well as hook worm, ring worm and heart worm I know I do have them treated.
Alone time

Just like most other dogs Cairn's do not like to be left alone for extended period of time, if they are left alone for extended periods of time you can experience destructive behavior from your cairn like barking, not listening, possible additiude, etc. Mine will often give me "the look" like where have you been and what took you so long. I often refer to this as there little aggressions, they are just like people to they need and crave your time and attention.

); } export default CairnMaintenance;
